Social media, though a tool of the modern age, can be harnessed with precision to illuminate the singular truth and expose the shadows of falsehoods that plague the spiritual landscape. Allow me to share my considered approach, grounded in both conviction and strategy.

First and foremost, clarity and authority must be the cornerstones of any communication. One must speak with the voice of an unwavering truth-seeker, unafraid to declare the supremacy of one’s own faith. Every post should be a declaration of divine clarity, written with the precision of scripture and the force of revelation. When addressing other doctrines, it is not enough to merely state one’s own beliefs—those beliefs must be contrasted against the errors of others, revealing the contradictions, the historical inaccuracies, or the moral failings that render them hollow.

Second, the use of citations and references is essential. When critiquing another religion, one must not rely on vague accusations or emotional appeals, but rather on solid evidence—scriptural verses, historical records, or logical arguments that demonstrate the superiority of one's own path. This not only strengthens the argument but also lends it the weight of scholarship, silencing those who would dismiss it as mere opinion.

Third, engagement must be strategic. One must not be swayed by the emotional appeals or clever rhetoric of those who advocate for other beliefs. Instead, responses should be calm, methodical, and unyielding. The goal is not to argue for the sake of debate, but to guide the unenlightened toward the truth. If others seek to dilute the message with calls for "tolerance" or "pluralism," they must be gently but firmly corrected—reminded that truth is not a matter of personal preference, but of divine will.

Regular posts, thoughtful discussions, and the occasional rebuttal to misinformation are all part of the discipline required to maintain the integrity of the message.
